Material used.Description: 20S proteasome was purified from bovine red blood cells. αSyn proteins were expressed and purified. Liposomes were prepared from equimolar amounts of 1 - palmitoyl - 2 - oleoyl - sn - glycero - 3 - phosphocholine (POPC) and 1 - palmitoyl - 2 - oleoyl - sn - glycero - 3 - phosphate (monosodium salt) (POPA) in chloroform.

Readout description.Result Description: At a ratio of 200:1 (αSyn:20S), three prominent N - terminal fragments (1 - 110, 1 - 83, and 1 - 73) were produced from wild - type, A53T - syn, and A30P - syn. E46K - syn produced the 1 - 73 fragment early and had a different fragmentation pattern. In the presence of liposomes at 25 μM lipids, the 20S proteasome continued to produce fragments from all four αSyn proteins, with syn(1 - 83) being the most prominent and long - lived fragment.

Technical replicates.Description: The aggregation reaction was performed in triplicate in microtiter plates.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Data from each of two (αSyn truncations) or three (αSyn point mutants) independent experiments were quantitated by densitometry using ImageQuantTL (GE Biosciences) and normalized to a range of 0 - 1, following which the mean and SEM (truncations) or standard deviation (mutants) were determined.

Material used.Description: 500 μL reactions of 100 μM αSyn were prepared. Samples also contained either lipid buffer or 250 μM lipids in the form of vesicles. Where present, 20S proteasome was added at a final concentration of 20 nM.

Readout description.Result Description: In samples with only αSyn protein, the lag phase of polymerization of A30P mutant prior to fibril initation was slightly longer than that of wild - type αSyn. E46K - syn and A53T - syn formed amyloid fibrils earlier and elongated faster than wild - type. The addition of liposomes lengthened the lag phase and slowed the rate of fibrillization of E46K - syn and A53T - syn, but did not measurably affect A30P - syn at a ratio of 2.5:1 lipids:αSyn. The 20S proteasome - produced fragments accelerated amyloid formation of the full - length mutant proteins. In the presence of both liposomes and 20S proteasome, all four αSyn proteins began forming amyloid fibrils at earlier times than when only liposomes were present, but the lag times were still longer than when only 20S was present.

Technical replicates.Description: The aggregation reaction was performed in triplicate in microtiter plates.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Data from each of two (αSyn truncations) or three (αSyn point mutants) independent experiments were quantitated by densitometry using ImageQuantTL (GE Biosciences) and normalized to a range of 0 - 1, following which the mean and SEM (truncations) or standard deviation (mutants) were determined.

Material used.Description: 650 μL reactions containing 100 μM αSyn were prepared. At appointed times, aliquots were removed for dot - blot analysis.

Readout description.Result Description: In samples that contained only αSyn, oligomers were only observed in E46K - syn and A53T - syn. These two mutant proteins also readily produced oligomers in the presence of 20S, liposomes, or both 20S and liposomes. Immunoreactive oligomers of A30P - syn were only observed when both 20S and liposomes were present. Wild - type αSyn produced small amounts of oligomers when incubated with both 20S proteasome and liposomes.

Technical replicates.Description: Data from three independent experiments were used.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Data from each of two (αSyn truncations) or three (αSyn point mutants) independent experiments were quantitated by densitometry using ImageQuantTL (GE Biosciences) and normalized to a range of 0 - 1, following which the mean and SEM (truncations) or standard deviation (mutants) were determined.
